com.google.code.infusion.util
Class OAuthLogin

java.lang.Object
  com.google.code.infusion.util.OAuthLogin

public class OAuthLogin
extends java.lang.Object

Contains helper methods for each of the 3 legs of OAuth authentication.

Method Detail

getRequestToken

public static void getRequestToken(java.lang.String scope,
                                   java.lang.String callbackUrl,
                                   AsyncCallback<OAuthToken> callback)
Step 1 of OAuth 1.0 authentication: Requests a request token for the given scope.

Parameters:
scope - The scope for authentication, usually the base URL of the service authentication is obtained for.
callbackUrl - Url to provide the verification code to (which will be generated in the second step. If null, "oob" (out of band) will be used, causing step 2 to print the verification code.
callback - The callback the request token will be sent to.

getAuthorizationUrl

public static java.lang.String getAuthorizationUrl(OAuthToken requestToken)
Construct the URL for the second step of OAuth authentication. Open a browser with this URL to enable the user to authorize the request. If successful, the verification code will be printed or sent to the URL provided in the first step.

Parameters:
requestToken - the request token obtained in the first step.

getAccessToken

public static void getAccessToken(OAuthToken token,
                                  java.lang.String verificationCode,
                                  AsyncCallback<OAuthToken> callback)
Third step of the OAuth process. Obtains an access token, given the request token and verification code. The access token can be used to sign URLs and to authenticate API access.

Parameters:
token - The request token
verificationCode - The verification code, obtained via the callback URL or from the user.
callback - The access token will be delivered to this callback.
